info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 18 at 4:22PM MDT until March 18 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Southern Otero County in south central New Mexico... Southeastern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... Hudspeth County in western Texas... El Paso County in western Texas...
* Until 715 PM MDT.
* At 421 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Fort Quitman.
HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging winds in excess of 60 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 163 and 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 17, and between mile markers 20 and 134. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 20.
Locations impacted include... Esperanza, Tornillo, Homestead Meadows, Little Box, Fort Hancock, Chaparral, East El Paso, West El Paso, Sunset Ranches, Sierra Blanca, Far Western Portions of Guadalupe Mountains National Park, Fort Bliss, Santa Teresa, Clint, Mission Valley, Sunland Park, Sparks, Brokeoff Mountains, Union Pacific Intermodal Terminal, and Central El Paso.
info.instruction:
Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 7:15 PM MDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 7:15 PM MDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; Otero, NM; El Paso, TX; Hudspeth, TX

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 7:15 PM MDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 7:15 PM MDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; Otero, NM; El Paso, TX; Hudspeth, TX
